oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Red Cross to Jeannettee Morris
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Red Cross to Jeannettee Morris regarding the capture of John Morris, captured March 28, 1918. Morris, a doctor, joined the Medical Reserve Corps in 1916. Upon US entry into World War I, he was assigned to the British army and served in the 42nd Royal Highland Regt., The Black Watch. He was wounded and captured at Ypres, Belgium in March 1918 and spent the remainder of the war as a POW. He returned to Somerville and practiced medicine and eventually became mayor.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
